info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 10:23PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN SUFFOLK AND NASSAU COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM EDT... At 1023 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hicksville, or over Plainview, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Islip, Brentwood, Levittown, Commack, Huntington Station, Centereach, Deer Park, Lindenhurst, Glen Cove, Plainview, Garden City, Massapequa, Hauppauge, Lynbrook, and Ronkonkoma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
